But I mean, are you basing your views on October and on the period where we've seen a significant deleveraging, but also some selling that's linked to redemptions, especially with hedge funds. I mean, are you taking to account to the fact that we could see $500 billion from hedge fund money be redeemed in the next three to six months?

No. I think that first of all, as I – that has been said by both Frédéric and Didier, in this environment, we are confident that we will gain market share and we're gaining market share. So, even in October so far it's a very short period of time to look at things. Our franchisees are still quite robust. So looking at the next three to six months, we might see some slowdown on the hedge fund side, but the hedge funds are accounting only for 10% which is significant, but it's 10% of our revenues in CIB. And even within the hedge fund side, the two side of our business is done on the business we're dealing with them as clients. So, there might be less hedge funds, yes but we think that we will gain market share, with the ones we will be left.
it's very difficult for us today to decide that we will trade down our head count because of franchises, if they are very resilient.
And you said you're gaining market share, are you gaining it against local investment banks or against foreign investment banks? I mean, is it against or is it against some of the firms?
It's very difficult to say. What I think is that, our Corporate and Investment Bank is extremely well positioned to capture the trend of these markets.
Okay.
So it's a – regarding all domestic and international competition.
Great, thank you very much.

That's it.

The next question is from Mr. Eric Vanpoucke from Sal. Oppenheim. Please go ahead, sir.

Yes. Couple of questions. The first one is regarding restructuring of asset management, should we expect any charge in Q4? Second one is regarding, I mean, the CDOs. I mean, can we expect potentially a disposal offer be over two portfolios left, and what would the potential impact? The third one is regarding your insurance branches. We had also of shares, can you comment on that? And finally, you did not commute on monolines. Is that some option, I mean, you would take them in for Q4?
Okay. Hi, Eric, I would let first Jean-Pierre answer the asset management question. I will take the other four.

If we have any restructuring charge in Q4 for the asset management side, it could be quite small potentially. I think the bulk should come once the – you know have completed the overall process with the representative of the staff, and as I said the project will be submitted in Q1 and it's only once the project has been submitted that we can take a restructuring charge. So expect that more for Q1 than Q4. I mean, Q4 if we have a factual adjustment then there could be some charge but not massive.

So regarding your second question on CDOs, we did not discuss into detail the scenarios which are describing the appendices but first of all on the two remaining portfolio of CDOs we have put into place as we have pushed our cumulus for two or five to 11% – it was previously 10% and we have also across-the-board increased let's say the population from subprime to prime which was previously 10 prime, was supposed to be 10% of the cumulus of subprime and now we are using 14% looking at the evolution of the . So overall this has triggered additional €295 million of marks on the bulk of year two and three. We believe that we are well conservative in this assessment of the evaluation of mark-to-model for and to use. We have also some liquidity add-ons. We have deleted in the appendices of the remaining, let's say underlying assets in these two CDOs. I would say we still wish to have them going forward from that.

Regarding insurance, we are making liquidity tests on a quarterly basis, which was actually at the end of September. Of course as usual, we will review these at the end of the fourth quarter. The question again – the cancellation of shares, which are mentioned in the press release, this is just I would say technical. This means that we are let's say buying shares or we bought share on the market to neutralize for the impact of the and you know that under the share buyback directives and we are compliance, you have 24 months to cancel the share to the start of the first initial acquisition on the market. We are closed from that, so the board yesterday did decide to cancel 10 million shares because of course no impact on the Tier One, on the cash position of the group because of the shares we already deducted from the equity and the Tier One. Last but not least let's say we are not mentioning on that from what I hear and what I read, there was no announcement from monolines internal communication despite let's say what was rumored -- I'm cautious with this word but rumored on the press over the last three months. So we will see when this communication will become real.
Any other question?
We have no further questions.
So, if not, I'll let Frédéric make the conclusion.

Yeah, I just would like to add something at the end of this two hours which is not financial. Let me just say, from a CEO perspective in such a crisis, the quality, the commitment, the dedication to the clients of the staff is absolutely critical.
